intro: Psychotria perferruginea, commonly known as the red-leaved psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves with prominent reddish veins, which give it its common name. Its small, tubular flowers are usually greenish-white in color and are borne in clusters. Psychotria perferruginea is often found in understory habitats of rainforests and is valued for its ornamental appearance.
